description: Borrowed from Latin obstreperus, first attested circa 17thÂ c.. Compare obstropulous.

adjectives.description: obstreperous (comparative more obstreperous, superlative most obstreperous)

entries.meaning: Attended by, or making, a loud and tumultuous noise; boisterous.
Stubbornly defiant; disobedient; resistant to authority or control, whether in a noisy manner or not.
examples: Synonyms: recalcitrant, uncooperative, unruly; see also Thesaurus:obstinate
